The password you entered is correct, but unfortunately your data is corrupt.
To resume using your phone, you need to perform a factory reset. When you set up your phone after the reset, you’ll have an opportunity to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account.

You can encrypt your accounts, settings, downloaded apps and their data, media, and other files. After you encrypt your phone, assuming you’ve set up a screen lock (that is, a pattern or numeric PIN or password), you’ll need to unlock the screen to decrypt the phone every time you power it on. The only other way to decrypt is to perform a factory data reset, erasing all your data.
Encryption takes an hour or more. You must start with a charged battery and keep your phone plugged in throughout the process. If you interrupt it, you’ll lose some or all of your data.
You need to set a lock screen PIN or password before you can start encryption.
No lock screen PIN or password

Encryption was interrupted and can’t complete. As a result, the data on your phone is no longer accessible.
To resume using your phone, you need to perform a factory reset. When you set up your phone after the reset, you’ll have an opportunity to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account.
The encryption operation is irreversible and if you interrupt it, you’ll lose data. Encryption takes an hour or more, during which the phone will restart several times.
To unlock your phone, turn it off and then on.
Charge your battery and try again.

Even with eyes protected by the green spectacles Dorothy and her friends were at first dazzled by the brilliancy of the wonderful City. The streets were lined with beautiful houses all built of green marble and studded everywhere with sparkling emeralds. They walked over a pavement of the same green marble, and where the blocks were joined together were rows of emeralds, set closely, and glittering in the brightness of the sun. The window panes were of green glass; even the sky above the City had a green tint, and the rays of the sun were green.
There were many people, men, women and children, walking about, and these were all dressed in green clothes and had greenish skins. They looked at Dorothy and her strangely assorted company with wondering eyes, and the children all ran away and hid behind their mothers when they saw the Lion; but no one spoke to them. Many shops stood in the street, and Dorothy saw that everything in them was green. Green candy and green pop-corn were offered for sale, as well as green shoes, green hats and green clothes of all sorts. At one place a man was selling green lemonade, and when the children bought it Dorothy could see that they paid for it with green pennies.
There seemed to be no horses nor animals of any kind; the men carried things around in little green carts, which they pushed before them. Everyone seeemed happy and contented and prosperous.
Chapter 11: The Wonderful Emerald City of Oz

Fingerprint Unlock creates a unique model of your fingerprint to verify it’s you. To create this fingerprint model during setup, you will take images of your fingerprint from different positions.

When you use Pixel Imprint, images are used to update your fingerprint model. Images used to create your fingerprint model are never stored, but the fingerprint model is stored securely on your phone and never leaves the phone. All processing occurs securely on your phone.
You can delete your fingerprint images and model, or turn off Fingerprint Unlock at any time in Settings. Fingerprint images and models are stored on the phone until you delete them.
Your phone can be unlocked when you don’t intend to, like if someone holds it up to your finger.

Fingerprint Unlock creates a unique model of your child’s fingerprint to verify it’s them. To create this fingerprint model during setup, they will take images of their fingerprint from different positions.

When they use Pixel Imprint, images are used to update their fingerprint model. Images used to create your child’s fingerprint model are never stored, but the fingerprint model is stored securely on the phone and never leaves the phone. All processing occurs securely on the phone.
You and your child can delete their fingerprint images and model, or turn off Fingerprint Unlock at any time in Settings. Fingerprint images and models are stored on the phone until they’re deleted.
Your child’s phone can be unlocked when they don’t intend to, like if someone holds it up to their finger.

App Clone allows you to log in to 2 similar apps, such as QQ and WeChat, at the same time. Now you can switch between accounts and link up primary and secondary accounts easily.
Go to Settings, tap App Manager, and then tap App Clone to enable this feature.
Change information permissions, manage notifications, enable split screen, fix the app’s position on screen, and perform other operations on the app at the snap of your fingers.
Go to “Multitasking” and tap on the app icon or pull down the app tab to select a function shortcut.
This feature supports consistent and comfortable screen reading for both day and night. Use customized themes or automatically switch between Light and Dark Modes at different times of the day.
Go to Settings, tap Display and Brightness, and then tap Interface Style followed by Auto Switch for more customizable options.
Can't capture your screen fast enough by pressing the Volume+ and Power buttons? Try this hand gesture for split-second screen capture.
When the screen you wish to capture is displayed on the tablet, touch any part of the screen with 3 fingers and swipe down quickly to capture the screen.
Try the Desktop Batch Organizer now to move desktop apps in batches, and categorize app packaging folders.
Tap and hold a blank area on the desktop to enable editing, tap and select multiple apps, pinch the icons together with two fingers, and then drag the icons to move them in a batch.

Is your desktop cluttered with an excessive number of apps? De-clutter your desktop now by storing the apps you’re not using in the Launcher, while keeping them at your fingertips using the Quick Search feature.
Go to Desktop, tap and hold a blank area to access Desktop Settings, select Desktop Style, and tap Launcher.

Have you been randomly placing icons on the desktop and now find it too tedious to organize them by manually dragging and dropping each icon? Try the Desktop Organizer, a must-have tool that satisfies even the obsessive compulsive organizers.
Go to Desktop, tap and hold the screen with two fingers, and then slide up or down to organize the desktop icons in a flash.

Having too many apps can make it difficult to locate the one you need. Trying to locate a specific app amidst a massive folder is no breeze either. Try this feature now to find your app at the snap of your fingers.
Go to Global Search, enter the name of the app, and then tap and hold the app to fix it in position on the desktop.
Constant switching between Portrait and Landscape displays can be very distracting,You can now get round this problem by locking the Landscape or Portrait display.

Pull down the Notification Panel, turn off Screen Rotation, and then exit the Notification Panel. Next, rotate the Device, and then tap the Lock Landscape or Portrait Display button at the bottom right corner of the screen.
With the screen you wish to capture displayed on the tablet, touch any part of the screen with 3 fingers and swipe down quickly to capture the screen.
After opening the screenshot, tap the slider on the right of the thumbnail, manually slide down the content you wish to capture, and then tap Finish to save and share.

Want to chat and browse the Internet at the same time, or shop while you compare prices? This feature supports concurrent display of two split-screens, and promises to satisfy even the most demanding multi-tasker.
Swipe more tasks into the interface of an app that supports split screen display, drop down app card and select “Split screen” to enable split screen display.
With screencasting, you can project your screen onto large-screen devices for enhanced work and learning efficiencies, and ultimate entertainment experiences.
Connect the large-screen device through Type-C connection, and then go to Multitasking and pull down the task tab to open Screencasting.
Bringing apps with vertical display to a landscape display, so you can easily switch between applications without turning the screen around.
